summary: This is an FBI Director's morning news briefing summarizing media coverage from September 4, 2019. It covers a wide range of topics including the California dive boat investigation, terrorism cases, political controversies, and the Jeffrey Epstein case, specifically noting a sealed address book with over 1,000 names connected to him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a sealed address book containing over 1,000 names connected to him, part of sealed court records under review.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as being involved in an earlier civil lawsuit, the sealed files of which a judge ordered an expedited private review.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: An attorney involved in the litigation concerning sealed Jeffrey Epstein records, stated the names are in depositions, investigatory records, and an address book.

persons.name: Loretta A. Preska
persons.context: Judge who said she wanted to release the sealed Epstein documents quickly and asked lawyers to provide briefs on which documents the public had the strongest right to see.

persons.name: James Comey
persons.context: Mentioned in a segment about sharing information from President Trump's transition briefing with the FBI's Russia probe team, as noted in an IG report.

persons.name: Andrew McCabe
persons.context: Reported to be headlining a fundraiser for Pennsylvania Democrats, where he would discuss the firing of James Comey, Russian meddling, and his interactions with Donald Trump.

persons.name: Robert Mueller
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to investigations stemming from his probe into Russian interference, including the case against Greg Craig.

persons.name: Greg Craig
persons.context: Acquitted of lying to federal authorities about work for the Ukrainian government, a case that grew out of the Mueller investigation.

persons.name: Ron Johnson
persons.context: Chairman of the Senate Homeland Security Committee who demanded answers from the FBI about a Trump Tower briefing on the Steele dossier, with the FBI not yet responding.

persons.name: Lindsey Graham
persons.context: Senate Judiciary Committee Chairman who released a letter seeking declassification of documents related to the origins of the FBI's Russia probe.

persons.name: Roger Stone
persons.context: Mentioned as his former aide, Andrew Miller, was subpoenaed to testify at Stone's trial for lying to Congress about dealings with WikiLeaks.

persons.name: Andrew Miller
persons.context: Longtime aide to Roger Stone subpoenaed to testify as a government witness at Stone's trial.

persons.name: Devin Nunes
persons.context: Filed a racketeering lawsuit against Fusion GPS and Campaign for Accountability, accusing them of smearing him over his investigation into the Steele dossier.

persons.name: Patrick Byrne
persons.context: Subject of a commentary about his wild story involving the FBI and Maria Butina, with the author arguing the FBI should explain its relationship with him.

persons.name: Alex Linder
persons.context: Run a website where photos of Jewish students were posted; the FBI was contacted by universities about the matter.

persons.name: Michael Grimes
persons.context: Pleaded guilty to wire fraud and money laundering as part of an FBI corruption probe into the United Auto Workers union.

connections.description: Maxwell is mentioned in the context of sealed files from an earlier civil lawsuit involving Epstein.
Miller is described as a longtime aide to Roger Stone.
Nunes filed a racketeering lawsuit against Fusion GPS, accusing them of smearing him.
Craig's case grew out of special counsel Robert Mueller's investigation into Russian interference.
Both are former high-ranking FBI officials mentioned in political controversies; McCabe was to discuss Comey's firing at a fundraiser.

events.title: News Briefing on Epstein Address Book
events.description: The New York Times reports a trove of sealed court records names hundreds connected to Jeffrey Epstein, including an address book with over 1,000 names. A judge orders an expedited review.

events.title: Greg Craig Acquitted
events.description: Former Obama White House counsel Greg Craig is acquitted by a federal jury of lying to federal authorities about his work for Ukraine.

events.title: Devin Nunes Files Lawsuit
events.description: Rep. Devin Nunes files a racketeering lawsuit against Fusion GPS and Campaign for Accountability.

events.title: Trump Administration Awards Opioid Grants
events.description: The Trump administration announces $1.8 billion in grants to states and local governments to combat the opioid epidemic.

events.title: FBI Assists in California Dive Boat Investigation
events.description: The FBI's dive team and evidence recovery team assist in the investigation of the Conception dive boat fire off Santa Cruz Island.

keyFacts: A sealed address book connected to Jeffrey Epstein contains over 1,000 names, according to attorney Jeffrey S. Pagliuca.
Judge Loretta A. Preska ordered an expedited private review of sealed files from a civil lawsuit involving Ghislaine Maxwell.
Former Obama White House counsel Greg Craig was acquitted of lying to federal authorities about work for Ukraine, a case stemming from the Mueller investigation.
The FBI had not responded to Senator Ron Johnson's May 2018 letter about the Trump Tower dossier briefing as of this briefing.
The Trump administration announced $1.8 billion in grants to combat the opioid epidemic.
